channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Builder completely blocking the pavement, 15th September
item.description:
This builder has been working for a number of days and has been intermittently making it hard to walk on the pavement. I have a broken leg, so have often had to go into the road. Today the payment was completely blocked for the whole day

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Lavers Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bromley black litter bin., 15th September
item.description:
A freestanding Bromley Black litter bin appeared outside 76 The Drive, BR3 1EG during night of Thursday 11September. For some reason, it was moved next morning from outside 76 The Drive by Council refuse collectors, to outside 74 The Drive, BR3 1EQ. Can this bin be returned to its previous location please? Thank you.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Uplands, Beckenham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Unauthorised Stands Outside Bermondsey Station, 15th September
item.description:
I am writing to raise a concern about individuals operating unauthorised stands directly outside Bermondsey Station, which I believe are set up without the appropriate permissions or licenses. These stands are often located at outside the main entrance to the station on High Street and appear to be distributing old food that past its "use-by" date, which is not okay by any standards, and this is illegal and poses a food safety risk. However, food past its "best-before" date can be distributed and consumed if it's still in good quality and suitable for consumption-however this is not the case here as often the food on the tables is rotten and smelly. The food is displayed on a dirty tables/in stolen shopping baskets and the food appears to be handled and stored unsafely, raising serious hygiene and public health concerns. This poses a risk to anyone consuming it. From what I can observe, there is no visible evidence that they have been granted permission by TfL or the relevant local authorities. This activity causes a lot of problems such as obstruction of pedestrian flow, littering, safety concerns, restricted disable access, restricted prams access, harassment of commuters (due to so many drunk/under influences of drugs people attracted by the stand) , and it undermines the rules that legitimate vendors or organisations must follow. This is an illegal food distribution activity taking place at Jamaica Road outside Bermondsey Station. The individual is operating a food bank or food distribution stand on public property without visible permits. I kindly request that this issue be investigated and appropriate action taken I would appreciate it if this issue could be looked into, and appropriate action taken to ensure that all activity outside the station complies with TfL policies,local council and licensing regulations.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Major Road, Bermondsey, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Manhole cover was not put back properly outside no.2 South Molton Street,, 15th September
item.description:
The shopkeeper keeps seeing people trip over the edge. It may have been put in backwards? Tried to put this on using manhole cover and it kept telling me everything on the map was private land?? Really need an upfront manhole cover category.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 2, South Molton Street, Mayfair, London
